NewWords.WordPhrase: n. 宅旁私家车道
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. A driveway is a road for vehicles that connects a private house or garage with the street.

NewWords.WordPhrase: vt. understand fully
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The child read the story but did not comprehend its full meaning.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. 草地，草坪
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Let's have tea on the lawn.

NewWords.WordPhrase: refuse to help (sb.) or to allow (sb.) to enter a place 拒绝帮助；不让…进入
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The hall was full, and hundreds of fans had to be turned away.

NewWords.WordPhrase: v. 除去…的杂草；除草  n.杂草，野草
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. A weed is an unwanted wild plant, esp. one which prevents crops or garden flowers from growing properly.

NewWords.WordPhrase: vt. suppose 假设；以为
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. If he's not here in five minutes, we'll assume (that) he isn't coming.

NewWords.WordPhrase: vt. praise 赞扬 n. 赞美的言辞或行为
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. I must compliment you on the way you handled the meeting.

NewWords.WordPhrase: plan; solve; calculate 制定出；解决；算出
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Have you worked out the answer/ the sum yet?

NewWords.WordPhrase: a. happening once a week or every week 每周的；一周一次的
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Are you paid weekly or monthly?

NewWords.WordPhrase: make clean and tidy 打扫，清除
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. It's your turn to clean (the kitchen) up.

NewWords.WordPhrase: a. giving help; useful 有帮助的；有用的
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. It was very helpful of you to do that typing for me.

NewWords.WordPhrase: (used in questions with what) 对待，处理
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. What have you done with my book?

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. 决心；决定
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The police chief spoke of his determination to catch the killer.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n.  人事部门；全体人员，全体职员
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The company's main problem is the shortage of skilled personnel.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. 学徒
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The company is taking on four new apprentices.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n.  the ability to understand or do sth. 能力，才能
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. He has a great capacity for enjoying himself.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. 测微计，千分尺
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. A micrometer is an instrument for measuring very small objects.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. the quality of being exact 精密；精确（性）
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Scientific instruments have to be made with great precision.

NewWords.WordPhrase: refuse 拒绝
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Thank you, but I'll have to turn down your offer.

NewWords.WordPhrase: v. （使）毕业   n. （尤指大学）毕业生
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. She graduated from Oxford with a first-class degree in physics.

NewWords.WordPhrase: a. having skill; needing skill 熟练的，有技巧的；技术性的
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. We need skilled workers / workers skilled in welding for this job; it is a highly skilled job.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n.  磨工
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. a coffee grinder

NewWords.WordPhrase: (ground)vt. 磨，磨碎，碾碎
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. We grind (up) the wheat to make flour.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. 工具，器械，仪器
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The pilot studied his instruments.

NewWords.WordPhrase: intended to be sold 待售
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. This picture is only on display; it's not for sale.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. 残破物（尤指失事船只、飞机等的）残骸
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The car was a total wreck.

NewWords.WordPhrase: visit (sb.) for a short time 拜访
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. We can call on Mary tomorrow.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. 银行家；银行高级职员
vt. lend (sth.) 借，贷   n. 贷款；借，贷
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Can you loan me your tennis racket?

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. （人的）品德；品质；性格
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The twins look alike but have very different characters.

NewWords.WordPhrase: a., n. (infml) (usu. used in negatives) of even the smallest amount 丝毫
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. His promise isn't worth a damn.

NewWords.WordPhrase: ad.  勉强地
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. She reluctantly accepted the money.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. 抵押借款，按揭
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. My mortgage is with a small building society.

NewWords.WordPhrase: vt. (fml) throw away 抛弃
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. I've discarded my old coat.

NewWords.WordPhrase: (also: odds and sods) 零星杂物，琐碎物品
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. He's moved most of his stuff; there are only a few odds and ends left.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. 纱门，纱窗；屏；荧屏
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. They put a screen around his bed so the doctor could examine him.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. 五金器具；（计算机的）硬件
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. You can buy what you need in that hardware store.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. a particular place; a small dirty mark 地点；斑点
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. On this map X marks the spot where the treasure is buried.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. 信心
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. She's a good student but she lacks confidence.

NewWords.WordPhrase: vt. surprise (sb.) very much 使惊愕，使诧异
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Your knowledge amazes me.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n.  辣椒；胡椒粉
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. I bought some green peppers for the salad.

NewWords.WordPhrase: a. 意大利的
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Can you tell me something about Italian history?

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. food and drink usually taken by a person or group日常饮食
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. A balanced diet and regular exercise are both important for health.

NewWords.WordPhrase: ask for the arrival of 派人去叫，召唤；派人去取
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. We may have to send to Japan for the spare parts.

NewWords.WordPhrase: v. 寻找；打猎
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. I have hunted high and low (= everywhere) for my socks.

NewWords.WordPhrase: vt. give up completely or forever 抛弃，放弃
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. When the fire got out of control, the captain told the sailors to abandon ship.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. land, buildings or both together; sth. which is owned（房）地产；财产
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. That car is my property; you mustn't use it without my permission.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. 小屋，棚  vt. 使脱落；使流出，散发出
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The army brought down the government, but without shedding blood.

NewWords.WordPhrase: ad.  某个时候
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. We'll take our holiday sometime in August, I think.

NewWords.WordPhrase: vt. 为…做保证人；主办，发起  n. 保证人；主办者，发起人
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The competition was sponsored by a big corporation.

NewWords.WordPhrase: vt. cause to laugh or smile; cause to spend time in a pleasant manner 逗乐，给...提供娱乐
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. His silly jokes amused the children.

NewWords.WordPhrase: v. come near/nearer to 接近
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The time is approaching when we will have to leave.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. 惊愕，诧异
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. To my amazement I came first.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n.  百万富翁
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. She leads a simple life though her father is a millionaire.

NewWords.WordPhrase: (euph) (esp. of a person) die 去世
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. She passed away in her sleep.

NewWords.WordPhrase: vt. manage; control 管理，处理；操纵
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. She didn't know how to handle the problem.

NewWords.WordPhrase: a. fit or pleasant to live in 适于居住的
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The house is not livable.

NewWords.WordPhrase: a.(infml) pleasant; like home 舒适的；像家一样的
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. a large, homey dining room

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. 拖拉机
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The tractor is the most widely used agricultural machine.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. 身材，身高；境界
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. She had not yet gown to (her) full stature.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. 工业家，实业家
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Professor Welch is writing an essay about some great industrialists of this country.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. 路线；路程
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. What's the shortest route from London to Cambridge?

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. guiding rule for behavior; basic truth 信条；原则；原理
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. One of the principles of this dictionary is that definitions should be in simple language.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. the ability to make great plans for the future; sight; the ability to see 远见；视觉，视力
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. I've had my eyes tested and the optician（眼镜商）says that my vision is perfect.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. 乐观主义
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. There is a note of optimism in his voice.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. proper respect for oneself 自尊;自重
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. She's got too much self-respect to beg her boyfriend to stay.

NewWords.WordPhrase: most important of all 最重要的是
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. And above all, remember to send us your comments.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. quality of being honest and responsible; state of being complete 正直；完整
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Our integrity as a nation is threatened by these separatist forces.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n.（梯子的）横档，梯级
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The director made his son start on the bottom rung of the ladder as an office boy.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n.  地下室
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. She lives in a basement.

NewWords.WordPhrase: a. of great size or force 巨大的  n. 巨人
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The giant (size) package gives you more for less money.

NewWords.WordPhrase: in spite of what has been said or done 毕竟, 终究
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. It has turned out to be a nice day after all.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. 平衡；余额
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. I found it hard to keep my balance on the icy path.

NewWords.WordPhrase: 资产负债表
n. 小数
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. You know 0.6 is a decimal because there's a decimal point between the 0 and 6.

NewWords.WordPhrase: vt. produce or make (esp. sth. new) 创造，创作
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The project will create up to 60 new jobs.
